thread.title: Eagles' Kiko Alonso sets target return date from knee injury
thread.title_full: Eagles' Kiko Alonso sets target return date from knee injury

author: Matt Lombardo | For NJ Advance Media
title: Eagles' Kiko Alonso sets target return date from knee injury
text:
Eagles' Kiko Alonso sets target return date from knee injury Kiko Alonso Philadelphia Eagles linebacker Kiko Alonso (50) warms up before the first half of an NFL football game between the Atlanta Falcons and the Philadelphia Eagles, Monday, Sept. 14, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/Brynn Anderson) (Brynn Anderson) Comments 
PHILADELPHIA -- Eagles inside linebacker Kiko Alonso has been sidelined since injuring his knee Week 2 against the Dallas Cowboys, but it doesn't sound like he'll be missing much more time. 
"I'm feeling pretty good," Alonso said following Thursday's practice at the NovaCare Complex. "The goal is the Cowboys game. I'm just going to try and do more and more every day." 
The Eagles will go on the bye week following Sunday night's showdown against the unbeaten Carolina Panthers, which will give Alonso an extra week to recover and a full six weeks since suffering the injury prior to his return.
